hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Decoupling During BTC Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a low-volatility consolidation phase (daily ATR < 2.5% for 3 consecutive days) while NEUTRAL regime persists, select altcoins with strong recent fundamentals (positive news flow, development activity spike) will decouple and outperform BTC by >8% over the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During neutral regimes with low BTC volatility, capital rotates toward altcoins with visible catalysts. The low correlation environment allows idiosyncratic factors to dominate over beta moves.
entry_conditions: Target altcoin (e.g., SOL, AVAX) has: (a) positive news sentiment score > 0.3 (7-day avg), (b) GitHub commit count > 30% above 30-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Altcoin/BTC ratio increases by 8% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Altcoin/BTC ratio decreases by 4% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of qualifying altcoins fail to outperform BTC by >5% during BTC consolidation periods in backtest.
